meanings.definition: To convey or transport using a conveyor system.
meanings.sent1: The factory workers were conveyorising the packages efficiently.
meanings.sent2: The airport conveyorises luggage to different destinations.
meanings.sent3: The robots were conveyorising items with dance moves, making the process fun.
meanings.sent4: The information flowed smoothly, conveyorising through the network like a river.
meanings.sent5: She watched as the sushi plates conveyorised around the restaurant, mesmerized by the system.

meanings.definition: The act of setting up or operating a conveyor system.
meanings.sent1: The conveyorising of the new assembly line took longer than expected.
meanings.sent2: His job involved overseeing the conveyorising of goods in the warehouse.
meanings.sent3: The conveyorising of the toys seemed like a magical dance of movement.
meanings.sent4: The conveyorising of thoughts in his mind was like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The conveyorising of the packages was a sight to behold, like a synchronized ballet of boxes.
